projects.title: Esports Portfolio Site
projects.description: A personal portfolio website developed for a prominent Esports professional. Due to the demands simply requiring a static website, the focus of this project was placed towards design and user experience.
projects.descriptionTwo: Tasked with creating an modern portfolio that was both minimalistic and eye catching. Displaying not only team rankings and achievments, but also solidfying it as a personal portfolio via the use of media.

projects.title: Personal Portfolio Site
projects.description: The website you are currently on, my very own portfolio site. Developed to dislpay projects, blog posts and other relevant information I wish to share.
projects.descriptionTwo: Ensuring the site was written in a way to encourage further development was important, in addition to generating content dynamically - allowing aspects like the number of projects to be a changing variable.

projects.title: LEGO Rubik's Cube Solver
projects.description: This was my dissertation and final project of my studies while at university. It ties together multiple interesting areas - the two main sections being robotics/automation with the charming mathematical puzzle of the Rubikâ€™s cube.
projects.descriptionTwo: Colour detection and recognition provided the most challenge during this project, due to issues such as glare impeding accurate results.

projects.title: VoIP System
projects.description: During the Networks module at University, I was tasked to design and implement a VoIP communication system. Given a set of data-gram sockets with a variety of faulty conditions.
projects.descriptionTwo: Each socket was analysised, diagnosed and the appropriate solution was implemented. An exmaple of this being packet-loss, solved via the use of interleaving.

projects.title: Augmented Reality App
projects.description: Each year the University of East Anglia holds on Open Day, allowing non-students in to explore the campus and its facilities. We were tasked with producing applications that may be useful for these visitors.
projects.descriptionTwo: An Augmented Reality application seemed like a stretch given the timeframe - but after some research and crafty workarounds it was achievable - allowing visitors to retrieve information about spots around campus on the go!

projects.title: Room Finder App
projects.description: Each year the University of East Anglia holds on Open Day, allowing non-students in to explore the campus and its facilities. We were tasked with producing applications that may be useful for these visitors.
projects.descriptionTwo: Exploring a new campus can be daunting, especially with UEA's many walkways -  the Room finder application ensures users can find their way around campus, incase they're seperated from their guide or simply want to focus on the areas that interest them.

projects.title: Car Finder App
projects.description: Each year the University of East Anglia holds on Open Day, allowing non-students in to explore the campus and its facilities. We were tasked with producing applications that may be useful for these visitors.
projects.descriptionTwo: After spending the entire day walking around a new cammpus, the last thing you want it to walk around it again, trying to remember where you parked. Thanks to this app, remembering where you parked is a problem of the past.

projects.title: Image Categorisation
projects.description: There are a large range on imagge recognition techniques available, in this assessment I was asked to implement some of them and compare the results.
projects.descriptionTwo: To test the different algortms, I fed each one the same set of training and test data. The two main algorthms discussed are kNN and SVM.
